body_html: I was able to build bazel-0.4.1 and tensorflow-0.12.0rc0 from source, on CentOS 6.5, without having root privileges. And it seem to work OK with glibc 2.12, without any LD_LIBRARY_PATH or LD_PRELOAD tricks. Editing tensorflow/tensorflow.bzl is one of the options (but it might be not the only thing to do), but, personally, for me it was simpler to do the same thing in "gpu/CROSSTOOL.tpl#L59".

body: I [was able](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/110#issuecomment-265431453) to build bazel-0.4.1 and tensorflow-0.12.0rc0 from source, on CentOS 6.5, without having root privileges. And it seem to work OK with glibc 2.12, without any LD_LIBRARY_PATH or LD_PRELOAD tricks. [Editing](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/53#issuecomment-164105922) `tensorflow/tensorflow.bzl` is one of the options (but it might be not the only thing to do), but, personally, for me it was simpler to do the same thing in "[gpu/CROSSTOOL.tpl#L59](https://github.com/leelabcnbc/DevOps/blob/master/Docker/tensorflow/0.10.0/centos6/py35/gpu/CROSSTOOL.tpl#L59)".
